formattedAddress: 219 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 219 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036-1423, USA

originalText.text:
Hadestown is a great show!
But if you want to enjoy it, do not purchase seats 4 or 6 in the box.
The theater might say it's a partial view, but no view is more accurate (see the attached photo).

But if you want to enjoy it, do not purchase seats 4 or 6 in the box.
The theater might say it's a partial view, but no view is more accurate (see the attached photo).

originalText.text: Hadestown was really spectacular! My first time at a Broadway show! The cast did really well and they fit their roles well. The story and music was quite incredible, I think Reeves really does a wonderful job my favorite song I think is the epics, I love a single voice and electric guitar. This is definitely worth seeing!

text.text: Hadestown was really spectacular! My first time at a Broadway show! The cast did really well and they fit their roles well. The story and music was quite incredible, I think Reeves really does a wonderful job my favorite song I think is the epics, I love a single voice and electric guitar. This is definitely worth seeing!

originalText.text: Great music, but pathetic 4 of 5 stars listed on the website aren't in the show. More we substituted than listed on the little print. It's shameful and pathetic. Thursday night. Hundreds of $$ for tickets. Bait and switch. All performers were talented, but it wasn't mind blowing. I've seen the show in the past and it was better. Solea Pfieffer was excellent.

originalText.text: Good not great.  Went to the matinee  The music and choreography made this performance.  The performances of orpheus and eurydice were underwhelming. They just don't have stage presence. And Orpheus sounds like a little girl. He can hit the notes but isn't captivating at all.  The band is phenomenal,  as are the 3 ladies that play the Fates.  There is one young lady in the chorus with great stage presence.  The rest of the cast are good..

text.text: Good not great.  Went to the matinee  The music and choreography made this performance.  The performances of orpheus and eurydice were underwhelming. They just don't have stage presence. And Orpheus sounds like a little girl. He can hit the notes but isn't captivating at all.  The band is phenomenal,  as are the 3 ladies that play the Fates.  There is one young lady in the chorus with great stage presence.  The rest of the cast are good..

originalText.text:
I was falling asleep during the show.  The main thing that kept me awake was my knees and hips hurting so bad from the cramped little seats.  It was an absolute ordeal every time someone would try and get past us to their seat.  Any older person with even a small amount of arthritis will absolutely HATE the seats!!!  The theater makes enough money in the seats that they need to shut down, remodel, and give people enough room to at least put your feet underneath your knees!

The actors and actresses were great!  I have no qualms with the acting.

Nevertheless, the plot drags on and on and on.  They sing the same song, at least twice. All of the music is soul type music with almost as much shouting as singing.  The songs sounded almost the same to me.
I wish I would’ve read the prior post of someone getting up and leaving during intermission. I almost did the same myself and wish I would have. After I left, I asked my wife and she felt the exact same way.

A lot of the audience seemed to love the show. I kind of feel like most of them have never seen Greek tragedies and/or Shakespeare.  For those that have been cultured, this may not be a show you like. For any that has a hard time sitting for three hours in a cramped seat, this is definitely not for you.

I would recommend going, and watching MJ the Musical, Back to the Future, Harry Potter, and Cursed Child…instead.  Hadestown is definitely not worth the price they charge.
